title: There Is No Art of the Deal With Vladimir Putin
sub_head: The value of any Russian commitment to Ukraine would be less than a ruble.
body:
Michael O’Hanlon sees a way out of Russia’s war against Ukraine (“Putin is Angry, but He Isn’t Mad,” op-ed, March 10). He suggests that the West could grant President Vladimir Putin his stated goal of barring Ukraine from membership in NATO in exchange for Russia’s “commitment to a verifiable arrangement.”
Never mind that Mr. Putin, in launching this war, reiterated his conviction that Ukraine is “an inalienable part of our own history, culture and spiritual space,” suggesting that his complaint about NATO shrouded a more sweeping ambition. As we have seen many times with arms control, “verifiable” agreements often prove tough to verify, and, once a clear violation has been spotted, then what?
